wikipedia_page.main: David M. Stevenson (17 January 1882 – 12 January 1938) was an Ulster Scot road racing cyclist who competed in the 1912 Summer Olympics. He was born in Clough, Ireland. In 1912 he was a member of the Scotland cycling team which finished fourth in the team time trial event. In the individual time trial competition he finished 41st.
